item.title: 2XKO adds Vi, PC closed beta begins September 9
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

"After Closed Beta begins, our goal is to keep the game online."

Vi, the Piltover Enforcer, will be a playable character in League of Legends-based free-to-play tag fighting game 2XKO, and a closed beta test will begin for PC on September 9, developer Riot Games announced. Sign-ups are available here.

“After Closed Beta begins, our goal is to keep the game online, outside of any necessary maintenance,” reads an update from Riot Games. “This is a huge step for us. We’ll be deploying our backend systems at a larger scale for the first time, so things might be bumpy at first, but we’ll improve as we go.

item.title: MARVEL Tokon: Fighting Souls playable at EVO 2025
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

Choose from six characters.

MARVEL Tokon: Fighting Souls will be playable at EVO 2025, which will run from August 1 to 3 at Las Vegas Convention Center, publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment and developer Arc System Works announced.

Attendees will be able to form a four-character team from a roster of six playable characters, including Captain America, Iron Man, Storm, Star Lord, Ms. Marvel, and Doctor Doom. Users who try out the demo will be gifted a collectible pin.

Additionally, Sony Interactive Entertainment, Arc System Works, and Marvel Games will host a “Developer Combat Panel” on August 1 at 8:00 p.m. PT / 11:00 p.m. ET, which will share new information on the core gameplay mechanics.

“I’d like to express our thanks on behalf of the entire development team for the incredible response to the State of Play trailer,” said Arc System Works game director Kazuto Sekine. “The game is still under development, but we’re really looking forward to sharing more in our Evo panel, and especially for fans to try it out for themselves with the very first trial version at the event. My hope is to ‘Assemble’ ith all of the players and create an amazing game together. We’re trying out many new things to offer a fresh experience. I can’t wait to hear your feedback and thoughts.”

MARVEL Tokon: Fighting Souls is due out for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in 2026.
